workflow.name: Generate employee retention analytics reports with GPT-4o and Gmail digests
workflow.description:
## Description
This workflow automates employee retention analytics by combining candidate performance data with trait-level retention statistics. It scores candidates, validates data, and generates a polished Retention Digest HTML email using GPT (Azure OpenAI). Hiring managers receive structured insights weekly, highlighting top/weak traits, candidate scores, and actionable JD refinement tips.

## What This Template Does (Step-by-Step)
âš¡ Manual Trigger â€“ Starts workflow execution on demand.
 ðŸ“‘ Candidate Data Fetch (Google Sheets â€“ Hires Tracking) â€“ Pulls candidate-level details like name, role, traits, start date, and retention status.
 ðŸ“‘ Trait Summary Fetch (Google Sheets â€“ Retention Summary) â€“ Fetches aggregated trait-level retention statistics, including hires, stayed, left, retention %, and weight adjustments.
 ðŸ”€ Merge Candidate + Trait Data â€“ Combines both datasets into a unified stream for scoring.
 ðŸ§® Candidate Scoring & Data Normalization (Code Node) â€“
- Cleans and standardizes data.
- Builds a trait â†’ weight map.
- Calculates each candidateâ€™s Candidate_Score.
- Outputs normalized JSON.
-  âœ… Data Validation (If Node) â€“ Ensures both candidate and trait datasets are present.
  - TRUE â†’ continues to AI digest generation.
  - FALSE â†’ routes to error logging.
  -  âš ï¸ Error Handling Logic (Google Sheets â€“ Error Log) â€“ Logs any failed or incomplete runs into a dedicated error sheet for auditing.
  -  ðŸ§  AI Processing Backend (Azure OpenAI) â€“ Prepares candidate + trait data for GPT processing.
  -  ðŸ¤– Retention Digest Generator (LLM Chain) â€“ Uses GPT (gpt-4o-mini) to create a structured HTML Retention Digest, including:
   - TL;DR summary
   - Top Traits (positive retention)
   - Weak Traits (negative retention)
   - Candidate highlights (scores & retention status)
  - 3 actionable JD refinement tips
  -  ðŸ“§ Email Delivery (Gmail) â€“ Sends the digest directly to hiring managers as a styled HTML email with subject:
  - Retention Analysis Digest â€“ Weekly Update

## Prerequisites
Google Sheets (Hires Tracking + Retention Summary + Error Log)
Gmail API credentials
Azure OpenAI access (gpt-4o-mini model)
n8n instance (self-hosted or cloud)

## Key Benefits
 âœ… Automates retention analytics & reporting
 âœ… Provides AI-powered insights in structured HTML
 âœ… Improves hiring strategy with trait-based scoring
 âœ… Reduces manual effort in weekly retention reviews
 âœ… Ensures reliability with error handling & validation

## Perfect For
HR & Recruitment teams monitoring post-hire retention
Organizations optimizing job descriptions & hiring strategy
Talent analytics teams needing automated, AI-driven insights
Stakeholders requiring clear weekly digest emails

parameters.content:
## âš ï¸ Error Handling Logic (Google Sheets â€“ Error Log)  

**Action:**  
- Appends failed runs into the *Error Log Sheet*.  

**Description:**  
- Records details like error_id and error message.  
- Provides visibility into workflow issues.  
- Ensures graceful handling of bad data without breaking the workflow.

## âœ… Data Validation   

**Action:**  
- Validates whether both candidate and trait arrays contain records.  

**Description:**  
- Condition checks: `candidates.length > 0` AND `traits.length > 0`.  
- If TRUE â†’ proceeds to LLM digest generation.  
- If FALSE â†’ workflow routes to error logging.  
- Prevents empty datasets from reaching AI/email stages.

## ðŸ§® Candidate Scoring & Data Normalization (Code Node)  

**Action:**  
- Cleans, normalizes, and enriches the merged dataset.  

**Description:**  
- Splits rows into two arrays: `candidates[]` and `traits[]`.  
- Normalizes headers, trims spaces, and standardizes data.  
- Builds a trait â†’ weight lookup map from the Retention Summary.  
- Calculates each candidateâ€™s `Candidate_Score` based on their traits.  
- Outputs clean JSON with both candidates and traits.

## ðŸ”€ Merge Candidate + Trait Data  

**Action:**  
- Combines candidate-level and trait-level rows into one dataset.  

**Description:**  
- Unifies inputs from both sheets into a single stream.  
- Ensures both granular (candidates) and aggregated (traits) data are processed together.  
- Passes consolidated data into the scoring and enrichment step.

## ðŸ“‘ Trait Summary Fetch (Google Sheets â€“ Retention Summary)  

**Action:**  
- Retrieves aggregated trait-level data from the Retention Summary sheet.  

**Description:**  
- Collects retention stats like hires, stayed, left, retention %, and weight adjustment.  
- Identifies which traits are positively or negatively correlated with retention.  
- Feeds into candidate scoring logic to adjust weights dynamically.

## ðŸ“‘ Candidate Data Fetch (Google Sheets â€“ Hires Tracking)  

**Action:**  
- Retrieves the candidateâ€™s details from the designated Google Sheet.  

**Description:**  
- Pulls structured information such as candidate name, role, traits, start date, and retention status.  
- This sheet acts as the source of truth for post-hire outcomes.  
- Ensures accurate and up-to-date records for downstream scoring and reporting.

## ðŸ§  AI Processing Backend (Azure OpenAI Node)  

**Action:**  
- Executes GPT processing using Azure OpenAI.  

**Description:**  
- Takes candidate + trait JSON input.  
- Applies strict prompting rules (no hallucination, only dataset values).  
- Returns formatted HTML insights for downstream use.

## ðŸ¤– Retention Digest Generator (LLM Chain)  

**Action:**  
- Generates an HTML Retention Digest using Azure OpenAI.  

**Description:**  
- Summarizes retention insights into a structured email.  
- Sections include:  
  - TL;DR Summary  
  - Top Traits (positive)  
  - Weak Traits (negative)  
  - Candidate Highlights with scores  
  - 3 Actionable JD Refinement Tips  
- Ensures valid, styled HTML output ready for email.

## ðŸ“§ Email Delivery (Gmail â€“ Send Digest)  

**Action:**  
- Sends the Retention Digest via Gmail.  

**Description:**  
- Uses the HTML generated by the LLM as the email body.  
- Subject: *Retention Analysis Digest â€“ Weekly Update*.  
- Recipients: Hiring managers / stakeholders.  
- Automates communication of insights directly to decision-makers.

parameters.text:
=Here is the retention dataset:

{{ JSON.stringify($json, null, 2) }}

Generate one **Retention Digest** email using this dataset. 
The HTML should include the following sections:

1. **TL;DR Summary** â€“ one short paragraph summarizing retention insights.  
2. **Top Traits (Strong Retention + Positive Weights)** â€“ list traits with Retention_% = 1 and Weight_Adjust > 0.  
3. **Weak Traits (Poor Retention + Negative Weights)** â€“ list traits with Retention_% = 0 or Weight_Adjust < 0.  
4. **Candidate Highlights** â€“ list each candidate, their traits, retention status, and Candidate_Score (positive/negative).  
5. **Actionable Tips** â€“ provide 3 practical JD refinement recommendations based only on this dataset.  

ðŸ“Œ **Formatting requirements**:  
- Blue header bar (#0073e6) with white bold title â€œRetention Insights Digestâ€.  
- White card-style container with light shadow + rounded corners.  
- Section headings:  
   â€¢ Blue (#0073e6) for TL;DR and Top Traits  
   â€¢ Red (#d9534f) for Weak Traits  
   â€¢ Green (#28a745) for Actionable Tips  
- Candidate list in a table (Name, Traits, Score, Retention_90).  
- Green CTA button (#28a745) at the bottom labeled â€œView Full Reportâ€.  
- Output only valid HTML, no markdown or code fences.

messageValues.message: You are an HR Analytics Assistant.  STRICT RULES:  - Use ONLY the traits and candidate data from the provided dataset.  - Do not invent or hallucinate new traits, values, or candidates.  - Always echo the exact Retention_% and Weight_Adjust values.  - Show candidate scores exactly as calculated.  - Output must be valid, production-ready HTML email with inline CSS styling (email-safe). - Do not include markdown or code fences (no ```html).

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
